title.narrative: OPT 1.1.2: SUPPLY HEALTH AND HIV

description.narrative: 1.1.2 Health networks and select services are strengthened and provide high impact interventions through quality and culturally appropriate health and HIV services., which contributes to Child Health, Health Systems Strengthening, Hiv â€“ General, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1.1 By 2017, high impact interventions in maternal/child health and HIV/AIDS are being equitably used by children, adolescents and mothers from the most disadvantaged communities in the intervention area

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.1.2 Health networks and select services are strengthened and provide high impact interventions through quality and culturallyappropriate health and HIV services.

description.narrative: In 2017 technical assistance was provided to Health Networks with a focus on: 1) developing capacities through training of health staff in maternal and child care; 2) increasing the number of health facilities that apply Continuous Quality Improvement Cycles; and 3) strengthening the prevention of vertical transmission of HIV. | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/12/2017
